text: Herbert W. "Herb" TrimpeFull name per Whitepages.com listing. Retrieved November 3, 2011. from the original November 3, 2011. (May 26, 1939 â€“ April 13, 2015) was an American comic book artist and occasional writer. He was best known as the seminal 1970s artist on The Incredible Hulk and as the first artist to draw for publication the character Wolverine, who later became a breakout star of the X-Men. He was born in Peekskill, New York. Trimpe died suddenly in Hurley, New York on April 13, 2015 at the age of 75. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American comics artists Category:American comics writers Category:Writers from New York (state)
title: Herb Trimpe
